It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Christisonia saulierei is considered a vulnerable species.
